Title: Behind the Sun
Writer: Karim Aïnouz (screenplay), Ismail Kadare (novel), Sérgio Machado (screenplay), João Moreira Salles (additional dialogue), Walter Salles (screenplay), Daniela Thomas (additional dialogue)
Actors: José Dumont, Rodrigo Santoro, Rita Assemany, Luiz Carlos Vasconcelos
Plot: The Brazilian badlands, April 1910. Tonho is ordered by his father to avenge the death of his older brother. The young man knows that if he commits this crime, his life will be divided in two: the 20 years he has already lived and the few days he has left to live, before the other family avenges their son's death. He is torn between fulfilling his ancestral duty and rebelling against it, urged by his younger brother Pacu. That's when a tiny traveling circus passes through the vast badlands where Tonho's family lives.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 8 wins & 4 nominations.
